oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Roy Acuff's Farmers Wholesale Nursery sponsored Grand Ole Opry. The tape is labeled Acuff's tape number four of an unidentified number. The tape features multiple recordings. The additional recordings are sponsored by American Ace Coffee and Royal Crown Cola. The recording features Grant Turner (host) and features performances by: Roy Acuff (musician), the Smokey Mountain Boys (musical group), Jimmie Riddle (musician), and Tommy Magness (musician). The tape is from a multitude of dates from: February 28, 1948; and March 01, 1948.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Grant Turner; Roy Acuff; Smokey Mountain Boys; Jimmie Riddle; Tommy Magness
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:16) Farmer's Wholesale Nursery Opening Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] (Roy Acuff) -- (00:46) Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- (01:27) Wait For the Light to Shine (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (03:39) Grant Turner performs a Farmers Wholesale Nursery commercial spot -- (05:58) Goin' South (Jimmie Riddle) -- (07:31) The Tramp on the Street (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (11:21) The Pale Horse and His Rider (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (12:35) Farmer's Wholesale Nursery outro tune [featuring Grant Turner vocal outro] [skips] ([Unidentified]) -- (13:16) Goin' South (Jimmie Riddle) -- (14:45) The Tramp on the Street (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (17:31) The Pale Horse and His Rider (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (20:32) Billy in the Lowground (Tommy Magness) -- (21:50) Unloved and Unclaimed (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (24:49) Be Honest With Me (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys) -- (26:49) Take My Hand Precious Lord (Roy Acuff and the Smokey Mountain Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Turner, Grant; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Magness, Tommy;
